intro: Agrostophyllum brachiatum var. latibrachiatum, commonly known as the broad-bracted agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The inflorescence consists of spikelets that are arranged in a panicle, bearing small, inconspicuous flowers. This plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in dryland environments.
